intro: Phyllanthus hivaoaensis, commonly known as the Hivaoa starleaf, is a rare endemic plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and unique floral structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of the island. Its botanical features include a short stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and small yellow flowers. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
